CVE-2011-0010.title: sudo: Privilege escalation — GLSA 201203-06
CVE-2011-0010.subTitle: Two vulnerabilities have been discovered in sudo, allowing local attackers to possibly gain escalated privileges.
CVE-2011-0010.background: sudo allows a system administrator to give users the ability to run commands as other users.
CVE-2011-0010.body: Two vulnerabilities have been discovered in sudo:
CVE-2011-0010.extra: A local attacker could possibly gain the ability to run arbitrary commands with the privileges of other users or groups, including root.

CVE-2011-0025.title: IcedTea JDK: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201406-32
CVE-2011-0025.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in the IcedTea JDK, the worst of which could lead to arbitrary code execution.
CVE-2011-0025.background: IcedTea is a distribution of the Java OpenJDK source code built with free build tools.
CVE-2011-0025.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the IcedTea JDK. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2011-0025.extra: A remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, cause a Denial of Service condition, obtain sensitive information, bypass intended security policies, or have other unspecified impact.

CVE-2011-0192.title: libTIFF: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201209-02
CVE-2011-0192.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in libTIFF could result in execution of arbitrary code or Denial of Service.
CVE-2011-0192.background: libTIFF provides support for reading and manipulating TIFF (Tagged Image File Format) images.
CVE-2011-0192.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in libTIFF. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2011-0192.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted TIFF file with an application making use of libTIFF, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application or a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2011-0411.title: Postfix: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201206-33
CVE-2011-0411.subTitle: A vulnerability has been found in Postfix, the worst of which possibly allowing remote code execution.
CVE-2011-0411.background: Postfix is Wietse Venema’s mailer that attempts to be fast, easy to administer, and secure, as an alternative to the widely-used Sendmail program.
CVE-2011-0411.body: A vulnerability have been discovered in Postfix. Please review the CVE identifier referenced below for details.
CVE-2011-0411.extra: An attacker could perform a man-in-the-middle attack and inject SMTP commands during the plaintext to TLS session switch or might execute arbitrary code.

CVE-2011-2896.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in GIMP. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2011-2896.extra: A remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or cause a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2011-2901.title: Xen: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201309-24
CVE-2011-2901.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Xen, allowing attackers on a Xen Virtual Machine to execute arbitrary code, cause Denial of Service, or gain access to data on the host.
CVE-2011-2901.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Xen. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2011-2901.extra: Guest domains could possibly gain privileges, execute arbitrary code, or cause a Denial of Service on the host domain (Dom0). Additionally, guest domains could gain information about other virtual machines running on the same host or read arbitrary files on the host.

CVE-2011-2938.title: MantisBT: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201211-01
CVE-2011-2938.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in MantisBT, the worst of which allowing for local file inclusion.
CVE-2011-2938.background: MantisBT is a PHP/MySQL/Web based bugtracking system.
CVE-2011-2938.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in MantisBT. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2011-2938.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to conduct directory traversal attacks, disclose the contents of local files, inject arbitrary web scripts, obtain sensitive information, bypass authentication and intended access restrictions, or manipulate bugs and attachments.

CVE-2011-2964.title: foomatic-filters: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 201203-07
CVE-2011-2964.subTitle: A vulnerability in foomatic-filters could result in the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2011-2964.background: The foomatic-filters package contains wrapper scripts which are designed to be used with Foomatic.
CVE-2011-2964.body: The foomatic-rip filter improperly handles command-line arguments, including those issued by FoomaticRIPCommandLine fields in PPD files.
CVE-2011-2964.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted PPD file, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the system user "lp".

CVE-2011-3012.title: Urban Terror: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201706-23
CVE-2011-3012.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Urban Terror, the worst of which allows for the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2011-3012.background: Urban Terror is a free multiplayer first person shooter developed by FrozenSand, that will run on any Quake III Arena compatible engine.
CVE-2011-3012.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Urban Terror. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2011-3012.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to connect to a malicious server or leverage Man-in-the-Middle attacks to cause the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2011-3026.title: libpng: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201206-15
CVE-2011-3026.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in libpng might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a Denial of Service condition.
CVE-2011-3026.background: libpng is a standard library used to process PNG (Portable Network Graphics) images. It is used by several programs, including web browsers and potentially server processes.
CVE-2011-3026.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in libpng:
CVE-2011-3026.extra: An attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running the vulnerable program, which could be the root user, or to cause programs linked against the library to crash.

CVE-2011-3031.title: Chromium: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201203-19
CVE-2011-3031.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in Chromium, some of which may allow execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2011-3031.background: Chromium is an open source web browser project.
CVE-2011-3031.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Chromium. Please review the CVE identifiers and release notes referenced below for details.
CVE-2011-3031.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted web site using Chromium, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, a Denial of Service condition, Universal Cross-Site Scripting, or installation of an extension without user interaction.

CVE-2011-3091.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Chromium and V8. Please review the CVE identifiers and release notes referenced below for details.
CVE-2011-3091.extra: A context-dependent attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted web site or JavaScript program using Chromium or V8, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, or a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2011-3148.title: Linux-PAM: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201206-31
CVE-2011-3148.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Linux-PAM, allowing local attackers to possibly gain escalated privileges, cause a Denial of Service, corrupt data, or obtain sensitive information.
CVE-2011-3148.background: Linux-PAM (Pluggable Authentication Modules) is an architecture allowing the separation of the development of privilege granting software from the development of secure and appropriate authentication schemes.
CVE-2011-3148.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Linux-PAM. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2011-3148.extra: A local attacker could use specially crafted files to cause a buffer overflow, possibly resulting in privilege escalation or Denial of Service. Furthermore, a local attacker could execute specially crafted programs or symlink attacks, possibly resulting in data loss or disclosure of sensitive information.

CVE-2011-3170.title: CUPS: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201207-10
CVE-2011-3170.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in CUPS, some of which may allow execution of arbitrary code or local privilege escalation.
CVE-2011-3170.background: CUPS, the Common Unix Printing System, is a full-featured print server.
CVE-2011-3170.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in CUPS. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2011-3170.extra: A remote attacker may be able to execute arbitrary code using specially crafted streams, IPP requests or files, or cause a Denial of Service (daemon crash or hang). A local attacker may be able to gain escalated privileges or overwrite arbitrary files. Furthermore, a remote attacker may be able to obtain sensitive information from the CUPS process or hijack a CUPS administrator authentication request.

CVE-2011-3194.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted TIFF image with an application linked against QtGui, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2011-3262.title: Xen: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201309-24
CVE-2011-3262.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Xen, allowing attackers on a Xen Virtual Machine to execute arbitrary code, cause Denial of Service, or gain access to data on the host.
CVE-2011-3262.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Xen. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2011-3262.extra: Guest domains could possibly gain privileges, execute arbitrary code, or cause a Denial of Service on the host domain (Dom0). Additionally, guest domains could gain information about other virtual machines running on the same host or read arbitrary files on the host.

CVE-2011-3323.title: Quagga: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201202-02
CVE-2011-3323.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities were found in Quagga, the worst of which leading to remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2011-3323.background: Quagga is a free routing daemon replacing Zebra supporting RIP, OSPF and BGP.
CVE-2011-3323.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Quagga. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2011-3323.extra: A BGP peer could send a Route-Refresh message with specially-crafted ORF record, which can cause Quagga's bgpd to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Quagga's bgpd; a BGP update AS path request with unknown AS type, or malformed AS-Pathlimit or Extended-Community attributes could lead to Denial of Service (daemon crash), an error in bgpd when handling AS_PATH attributes within UPDATE messages can be exploited to cause a heap-based buffer overflow resulting in a crash of the daemon and disruption of IPv4 routing, two errors in ospf6d and ospfd can each be exploited to crash the daemon and disrupt IP routing.

CVE-2011-3626.title: Logsurfer: Arbitrary code execution — GLSA 201201-04
CVE-2011-3626.subTitle: A double-free flaw in Logsurfer allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code.
CVE-2011-3626.background: Logsurfer is a real time log monitoring and analysis tool.
CVE-2011-3626.body: Logsurfer log files may contain substrings used for executing external commands. The prepare_exec() function in src/exec.c contains a double-free vulnerability.
CVE-2011-3626.extra: A remote attacker could inject specially-crafted strings into a log file processed by Logsurfer, resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the permissions of the Logsurfer user.

CVE-2011-5035.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in the IcedTea JDK, the worst of which could lead to arbitrary code execution.
CVE-2011-5035.background: IcedTea is a distribution of the Java OpenJDK source code built with free build tools.
CVE-2011-5035.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the IcedTea JDK. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2011-5035.extra: A remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, cause a Denial of Service condition, obtain sensitive information, bypass intended security policies, or have other unspecified impact.

CVE-2011-5244.title: T1Lib: : Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201701-57
CVE-2011-5244.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in T1Lib, the worst of which could lead to remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2011-5244.background: T1Lib is a library for rasterizing bitmaps from Adobe Type 1 fonts.
CVE-2011-5244.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in T1Lib. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2011-5244.extra: Remote attackers, by coercing users to process specially crafted AFM font or PDF file, could cause a Denial of Service condition or execute arbitrary code.
